greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of Carmichael lambda(n) and n - 1.
comment: n is a Giuga number and A002322(n)/a(n) divides k if and only if 1^(k*(n-1)) + 2^(k*(n-1)) +...+ (n-1)^(k*(n-1)) = -1 (mod n).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. M. Grau and Antonio Oller-Marcén, Generalizing Giuga's conjecture, arXiv:1103.3483 [math.NT], 2011.
results.author: _José María Grau Ribas_, Mar 13 2011
